item.title: Owner Attacking Anywhere (Out Of Wildy) Help!

@x_blitz_x wrote:

Try this,

    public boolean nonWild() {
        if(playerRights > 2) { // 3 Rights Or More.
            return false;
        }

        }

item.title: Owner Attacking Anywhere (Out Of Wildy) Help!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

It doesn’t work. I get no errors, but it doesn’t work. I had this code under my process() to make it so when you’re not in the wildy it removes the attack option:

if(nonWild()) { setOption("null", 3, 1); } else if(!nonWild()) { setOption("Attack", 3, 1); }

But then I added this so the attack option is always displayed for “God”

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("God")) { setOption("Attack", 3, 1); }

If that matters at all… But other than that it still doesn’t work. His player rights are 10. But that shouldn’t be a problem because it says in the code rights 3 and up.

Read full topic
item.source: Owner Attacking Anywhere (Out Of Wildy) Help!

item.title: Owner Attacking Anywhere (Out Of Wildy) Help!
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[code] case 73: //Attack (Wilderness)

		if (PkingDelay <= 1) {
			AttackingOn = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
			client plz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn];
			client AttackingOn2 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn];

		if (!nonWild() && !plz.nonWild() && plz != null || playerRights >= 3) {
			IsAttacking = true;
			inCombat();
			plz.inCombat();
		if (GoodDistance(absX, absY, EnemyX, EnemyY, 1) == true) {
			setAnimation(GetWepAnim());
		} else {
		}
		if (server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn] != null) {
			if (server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX != absX && server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY != absY)
				viewTo(server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX, server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY);
				faceNPC = 32768+AttackingOn;
				faceNPCupdate = true;
				}
			}
		}
		break;[/code]

Should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Owner Attacking Anywhere (Out Of Wildy) Help!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I want to make a code so I can attack players anywhere, regardless if it’s wildy or not. I’ve been trying random things and putting it under my process() method. I’ve tried this:

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("God")) { leftwild = 1; InWildrange = true; }

Don’t laugh at me for that, I’m just trying random things and random pieces of code from my wildy code… I wouldn’t know what to do to make it so only “God” can attack anyone anywhere. Help is appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: Owner Attacking Anywhere (Out Of Wildy) Help!
